reviewText: Troy Perry is a nut, as most religious people are, but he did the right thing by being front and center on important issues. And if you are going to fight the right wing nut jobs it is good to have one of them on your side.

This is an inspirational film about a gay activist reverend that you might not have known much about.  He started the Metropolitan Community Church which was the first church to minister specifically to gay people.  What a brave, articulate, and truly dedicated individual!  I'm so glad I watched this story.  It reminded me that if we want to change the world, we need to take some responsibility and get involved in some action ourselves.  I'm inspired.  I would highly recommend this movie/documentary.

I had the privilege and pleasure of meeting Troy when I was an at risk youth. M.C.C. and Troy helped me find my way. I  went from being a homeless youth to working in the computer industry and helping others.  I am glad that his (and M.C.C.'s) story is being told.
A great documentary about Troy's call to serve God and the struggles along the way. He was and is a rebel an inspiration to the LGBTQ community!!
Great film on a charismatic man. who started the Metropolitan Community Church.
very good Biography of Troy Perry.  Unfortunate I had to watch it on a small computer screen instead of my big 42" TV
Did not play in either of my dvd players.  Watched on the computer.  A very good Biography of Reverend Perry's life up to early 2000's.  Just wish it had been a real dvd.
